text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sarajevo press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bosnia is offered to enter Europe but Bosnians are prevented to stay in Europe, writes "Oslobodjenje's columnist, Zoran Pirolic, on the issue of forced return of Bosnian refugees from the West.
- Bosnian businessmen visit Macedonia and agree with their partners that Skopje serves as transit point for goods to be transported to Bosnia.
- The Bosnian Army 5th corps began destruction of its surplus arms. All work will be completed within 20 days, Atif Dudakovic, commander of the 5th corps told a news conference.
- A Malaysian businessman opens "Orient Bank" in Bosnia and says that investment will follow Islamic principles.
- New navigation gear donated by French governement will be set up soon at the Sarajevo airport, Bakir Karahasanovic, manger of the airport told Oslobodjenje.
- Three-man presidency meeting is scheduled for Wednesday. The constitution of the council of ministers will be the main issue on their agenda.
- Bosnian health workers go on 24 hour warning strike on Monday to demand federal government meet their demands to pay them salaries.
